6: I have been impressed with the UA map my walk results. I walk a path around a lake everyday and it does a great job of sticking to my path, including a side step to fix my shoes this morning. I’m still only doing 3 miles a day, so it showing 3 wiggly rings around the lake and then the hook back to my car
7: How did I not know this existed?! Thank you!
8: I have MapMyWalk that saves where I’ve walked
9: You might look into the American Discovery Trail. Dave Whitson does a great podcast about the Camino de Santiago, and has walked a lot around Europe, but in 2020 he set out to walk the ADT. Covid, unsurprisingly, unraveled much of his plan, but he did get some of it done before he had to end the trek. It sounds like it might be worth your time to dig a bit into it.
10: This is also on my list of "random shit I'd do if I won the lottery," right underneath "kayak the Mississippi river." Hope you can make it work!
